result.execSummary:
The defendant Vaylan G Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges  - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the victim or the location of this offense.

Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vaylan G Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vaylan G Morris in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time. 
Credit for 3 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.
* No contact with the victim or the location of this offense.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
   
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Vaylan G Morris in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed telephone contact.)

Defendant Vaylan G Morris in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Vaylan G Morris in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/30/15.
css

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANTHONY B. OR HIS RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Vaylan G Morris in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Vaylan G Morris in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
